events.title: Death of Charles Martel
events.description: Charles Martel, Frankish statesman and military leader, died. Known for his role in the Battle of Tours where he halted the advance of Islamic forces into Western Europe.
events.significance: His leadership laid the groundwork for the Carolingian Empire and the rise of Charlemagne.

events.title: Completion of the Statue of Liberty's Pedestal
events.description: The pedestal supporting the Statue of Liberty was completed in New York Harbor, allowing for the official dedication of the monument later that year.
events.significance: Marked the final stage in making the Statue of Liberty a symbol of freedom and democracy in the United States.

events.title: Start of the Iraq War
events.description: The United States, along with coalition forces, began the invasion of Iraq, initiating the Iraq War aimed at toppling Saddam Hussein's regime.
events.significance: Led to significant geopolitical changes in the Middle East and had lasting impacts on international relations.

events.title: Angloâ€“French Declaration
events.description: The United Kingdom and France issued a joint declaration promising to establish a free and independent Arab state post-World War I.
events.significance: Influenced the post-war political landscape of the Middle East and colonial mandates.
